definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: We want to put equity in, but we don’t want to nationalize the banks.
sentences.chinese: 我們想入股銀行，但是並不想將銀行國有化。

sentences.english: Blue and eloquent, want to wear bone suitable to personally take a stake in the new company.
sentences.chinese: 藍菲兒巧舌如簧，希望戴骨順以個人名義入股新公司。

sentences.english: I'm not ready to plunk my money into any of these.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒有準備好把錢入股以上任何一家公司。

sentences.english: Mr. Jiang also didn't identify the local brokerage the bank plans to invest in.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他也未透露交行打算入股的券商名稱。

sentences.english: Mltsubishi has become a shareholder of Southeast Auto directly.
sentences.chinese: 三菱汽車直接入股東南汽車，給後者注入更多的活力。

definition: to inject funds/to put money into (the market)
to own a controlling number of shares in a company
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
to fund/to put money into sth/to invest
merger and acquisition (M and A)/acquisition/to take over
Ali Baba, character from The Arabian Nights
to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
